IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MISSION:CULTIVATING THE POTENTIAL OF YOUNG WOMEN THROUGH A CHALLENGING, HOLISTIC EDUCATION ROOTED IN THE URSULINE TRADITION.VISION:EMPOWERING YOUNG WOMEN, CHANGING THE WORLD. SERVIAM GIRLS ACADEMY IS A TUITION-FREE, INDEPENDENT CATHOLIC MIDDLE SCHOOL WHOSE FAMILIES MUST QUALIFY FOR THE FEDERAL FREE/REDUCED SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM IN ORDER TO ENROLL.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MISSION: CULTIVATING THE POTENTIAL OF YOUNG WOMEN THROUGH A CHALLENGING, HOLISTIC EDUCATION ROOTED IN THE URSULINE TRADITION.VISION: EMPOWERING YOUNG WOMEN, CHANGING THE WORLD. SERVIAM GIRLS ACADEMY IS A TUITION-FREE, INDEPENDENT CATHOLIC MIDDLE SCHOOL WHOSE FAMILIES MUST QUALIFY FOR THE FEDERAL FREE/REDUCED SCHOOL LUNCH PROGRAM IN ORDER TO ENROLL.
IRS990.Desc: SERVIAM GIRLS ACADEMY EDUCATES ON AVERAGE 40-60 GIRLS, GRADES 5 - 8, WITH A COMPREHENSIVE MODEL THAT INCLUDES AN EXTENDED 10-HOUR DAY AND 10.5-MONTH YEAR, INCLUDING A MANDATORY FOUR-WEEK SUMMER PROGRAM; SMALL CLASS SIZES; AND, A GRADUATE SUPPORT PROGRAM THAT WORKS WITH SERVIAM GRADUATES THROUGH HIGH SCHOOL GRADUATION AND INTO COLLEGE.PROGRAM ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE:1. SERVIAM'S 8 MEMBER CLASS OF 2023 WERE OFFERED OVER $666,000 IN SCHOLARSHIPS AND AID TO FIVE LOCAL PRIVATE SCHOOLS. THE RISING FRESHMEN ARE ENROLLED IN THE FOLLOWING HIGH SCHOOLS: DELCASTLETECHNICAL HIGH SCHOOL, HODGSON TECHNICAL HIGH SCHOOL, HOWARD HIGH SCHOOL OF TECHNOLOGY, PADUA ACADEMY, SANFORD SCHOOL, AND URSULINE ACADEMY. OUR MISSION IS TO PREPARE GIRLS TO SUCCEED IN HIGH SCHOOL THROUGH A CHALLENGING AND RELEVANT EDUCATION, THUS THE VAST MAJORITY OF OUR BUDGET IS GEARED TOWARD THIS SPECIFIC GOAL2. SERVIAM'S 12 MEMBERS OF THE CLASS OF 2023 GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL. OVER 80% WILL MATRICULATE INTO THE FOLLOWING COLLEGES: THOMAS JEFFERSON UNIVERSITY, FISHER COLLEGE, GEORGE MASON UNIVERSITY, UNIVERSITY OF DELAWARE, DELAWARE STATE UNIVERSITY, AND WIDENER UNIVERSITY.3. DURING ITS THIRD YEAR IN ITS NEW HOME AT 900 NORTH WASHINGTON STREET IN DOWNTOWN WILMINGTON, DE, SERVIAM GIRLS ACADEMY WELCOMED ITS FIRST EVER CROSS COUNTRY TEAM AND COMPETED THROUGHOUT THE FALL. THE BASKETBALL TEAM WON FIRST PLACE IN THEIR DIVISION AND THE CAPOEIRA PROGRAM CONTINUED FOR STUDENTS DURING THEIR SCHOOL DAY. TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES STUDENTS STILL FACE FROM THE LASTING EFFECTS OF COVID, SERVIAM CONTINUED THE CONTRACT WITH A COUNSELOR TO CONDUCT WEEKLY GROUP SESSIONS AS WELL AS THE OPPORTUNITY FOR STUDENTS (AND STAFF) TO MEET ONE-ON-ONE. HAVING WITNESSED POSITIVE RESULTS, SERVIAM WILL CONTINUE THIS SERVICE.4. SERVIAM LAUNCHED IT'S THIRD MULTI-YEAR PLEDGE CAMPAIGN IN SEPTEMBER 2021 WITH A GOAL TO RAISE $3 MILLION IN PLEDGES FOR THE NEXT FIVE YEARS. BY JUNE 30TH, SERVIAM HAD RECEIVED OVER $2.83 MILLION IN PLEDGES TO SUPPORT OPERATIONAL EXPENSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A NOTICE OF THE NON-DISCRIMINATION POLICY IS PUBLISHED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE AND IS ALSO AVAIABLE IN CATALOGUES AND BROCHURES DISTRIBUTED TO THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SERVIAM IS A NON-STOCK CORPORATION WITH FIVE MEMBERS. THE MEMBERS ARE NOT TRUSTEES OF THE GOVERNING BODY. RATHER, THEY HAVE RESERVED RIGHTS AND POWERS EXCLUSIVE TO THE MEMBERS, INCLUDING THE ELECTION OF GOVERNING BODY AND REMOVAL OF ANY DIRECTOR; THE APPOINTMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL AUDITOR AND ITS ATTORNEY, AND APPROVAL OF THE FINANCIALS; HIRING THE PRESIDENT AND NAMING THE CHAIR; AMENDING THE BY-LAWS; AUTHORIZING CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS OR THE SALES OF ASSETS; AND THE MERGER, CONSOLIDATION, OR DISSOLUTION OF THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FROM OUR BYLAWS, AND ADHERED TO ON ALL ACCOUNTS: SECTION 6. POWERS RESERVED TO MEMBERS. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY PROVISION OF THESE BYLAWS TO THE CONTRARY, THE FOLLOWING POWERS ARE RESERVED EXCLUSIVELY TO THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION: (A) TO ARTICULATE AND MEDIATE THE PHILOSOPHY OF THE CORPORATION, INCLUDING THE APPROVAL OF THE MISSION STATEMENT, MAJOR POLICY CHANGES, AND LONG-RANGE PLANNING OBJECTIVES OF THE CORPORATION; (B) TO APPOINT, BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF ALL THE MEMBERS, THE DIRECTORS AND THE CHAIRPERSON OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS (THE "CHAIR") AFTER HAVING CONSIDERED RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS; (C) ALL DECISIONS AND APPROVALS REGARDING THE APPOINTMENT AND EMPLOYMENT OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION (THE "PRESIDENT"), WHICH SHALL BE BY MAJORITY VOTE OF ALL THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION AFTER HAVING CONSIDERED RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, PROVIDED THAT THE MEMBERS SHALL NOT HAVE THE POWER TO TERMINATE THE PRESIDENT PRIOR TO THE EXPIRATION OF HIS OR HER THEN CURRENT TERM OF EMPLOYMENT (WHETHER BY CONTRACT OR OTHERWISE) UNLESS SUCH TERMINATION HAS BEEN APPROVED BY AT LEAST 66 2/3% OF THE VOTING POWER OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION; (D) TO AMEND, ALTER, OR REPEAL ANY PROVISIONS CONTAINED IN THE CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF THE CORPORATION (THE "CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION"), AND ALL RIGHTS CONFERRED HEREIN ARE GRANTED SUBJECT TO THIS RESERVATION; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NO AMENDMENT SHALL AUTHORIZE THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO CONDUCT THE AFFAIRS OF THE CORPORATION IN ANY MANNER OR FOR ANY PURPOSE CONTRARY TO THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE CODE, OR THE CORRESPONDING PROVISION OF ANY SUBSEQUENT FEDERAL TAX LAW; (E) TO AUTHORIZE, AFTER APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, ALL CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS AND ANY SALE, MORTGAGE OR SUBORDINATION OF INTEREST IN THE ASSETS OF THE CORPORATION; (G) TO MERGE, CONSOLIDATE OR DISSOLVE THE CORPORATION, PROVIDED THAT SUCH ACTIONS MAY BE TAKEN ONLY IF THEY DO NOT CHANGE THE TAX-EXEMPT STATUS OF THE CORPORATION AS AN EDUCATIONAL OR CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION; (H) TO APPOINT THE FINANCIAL AUDITOR OF THE CORPORATION AND TO APPROVE THE ANNUAL AUDIT OF THE CORPORATION; AND (I) TO APPOINT THE ATTORNEY FOR THE CORPORATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SERVIAM IS A NON-STOCK CORPORATION WITH MEMEBERS. THE MEMBERS ARE NOT TRUSTEES OF THE GOVERNING BODY. RATHER, THEY HAVE THE RIGHT TO ELECT THE GOVERNING BODY OR TO REMOVE ANY DIRECTOR. THEY ALSO HAVE CERTAIN POWERS RESERVED UNTO THEMSELVES INCLUDING APPROVING THE FINANCIALS, HIRING THE PRESIDENT, AND NAMING THE CHAIR. THE MEMEBERS APPROVE CERTAIN DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY INCLUDING, FOR EXAMPLE, THE HIRING OF THE PRESIDENT; THE APPOINTMENT OF THE CHAIR; THE AMENDMENT OF THE BY-LAWS; THE AUTHORIZATION OF CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS OR SALES OF ASSETS; THE MERGER, CONSOLIDATION, OR DISSOLUTION OF THE CORPORATION; THE APPOINTMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL AUDITOR AND IT'S ATTORNEY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DRAFT 990 IS REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, WHO AFTER ANY NEEDED REVISIONS ARE MADE, SENDS THE "APPROVED" 990 TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND THE BOARD OF MEMBERS FOR FINAL APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTOR REQUIRES ALL BOARD MEMBERS TO REVIEW THE POLICY AND SIGN OFF ON THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM EVERY SEPTEMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEET WITH THE PRESIDENT FOR AN ANNUAL REVIEW AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR HER COMPENSATION TO THE FULL COMMITTEE. FINAL APPROVAL IS OBTAINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. SALARY ACTUALS REVIEWED MONTHLY BY BREAKWATER VIA PAYROLL POSTINGS. THE BOARD REVIEWS TOTAL MONTHLY COMPENSATION VIA FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND ANALYTICS. BUDGET IS REVIEWED AGAINST ACTUALS MONTHLY BY BOARD & BREAKWATER

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
